Description: Rim sherd of Chian Wild Goat Style pottery chalice; white slip; interior: reserved band at rim, glazed streaky black below; top of rim glazed; exterior: maeander pattern around rim, running left; below, painted decoration consisting of part of goat’s horn to right, slightly overlapping onto the maeander band above; inscription on interior.
Curator's comments: The sherd probably from same vase as British Museum 1888,0601.473.m, 1888,0601.478.l and 1888,0601.478.m and 1924,1201.309.a. Lemos describes this sherd as being in the style of the Würzburg chalices, as the sherds from this group display patterns on the different parts of the vessel which are similar to those depicted on the Würzburg chalices (Lemos 1991, 72).
Bibliographic references: Lemos 1991 / Archaic Pottery of Chios. The Decorated Styles (p. 237, no.174)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.0138) (phase 2)
